alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 4:04PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern McCurtain County through 445 PM CDT... At 404 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southwest of Octavia, or 26 miles southeast of Clayton, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Battiest, Pickens and Bethel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
